docs.lead_paragraph: Tests show that some of the best-selling cars in Latin America and the Caribbean don’t provide much crash protection. None of the lowest-rated cars meet the safety requirements of the U.S. or Europe.

headline.seo: Grim Findings in Latin Crash Tests
headline.main: Grim Findings in Latin Crash Tests
headline.print_headline: Grim Findings in Latin Crash Tests

docs.abstract: Safety tests conducted by Latin American New Car Assessment Program show that some of the best-selling cars in Latin America and the Caribbean provide extremely poor crash protection; none of the lowest-rated cars meet the safety requirements of the United States or Europe.
docs.snippet: Tests show that some of the best-selling cars in Latin America and the Caribbean don’t provide much crash protection. None of the lowest-rated cars meet the safety requirements of the U.S. or Europe.

docs.lead_paragraph: A surprising drug has brought a kind of consciousness to patients once considered vegetative — and changed the debate over pulling the plug.

headline.main: A Drug That Wakes the Near Dead

docs.abstract: Jeneen Interlandi article describes how a growing body of case reports suggests that the popular sleep aid Ambien, or its generic twin zolpidem, appear to awaken comatose patients.
docs.snippet: A surprising drug has brought a kind of consciousness to patients once considered vegetative — and changed the debate over pulling the plug.

docs.lead_paragraph: His camp doesn’t need to turn their guy into someone you’d have a beer with. They just need to eliminate the bugs in the machine.
docs.abstract: Robert Draper article examines reasons behind decision by Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney's campaign to portray him as a fixer and a business man, rather than someone voters would feel comfortable having a beer with.
docs.snippet: His camp doesn’t need to turn their guy into someone you’d have a beer with. They just need to eliminate the bugs in the machine.

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A geriatrician urges that health reform be focused more on care issues than monetary ones.
docs.snippet: A geriatrician urges that health reform be focused more on care issues than monetary ones.

docs.lead_paragraph: Art handlers for Sotheby's, locked out of their jobs since August in an increasingly bitter union contract dispute with the auction house, have been both inventive and voluble in their protest tactics, traveling to London to picket auctions and even showing up at businesses owned by Sotheby's board members. On Thursday night two of the art handlers interrupted a planning meeting attended by Diana L. Taylor, a Sotheby's board member and Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg's girlfriend, and demanded that she help end the lockout. Initially, Ms. Taylor seemed to ignore the interruption but then she leaned into her microphone and made her position known clearly, in stern tones.
docs.abstract: Art handlers for Sotheby's, who have been locked out of their jobs while involved in union contract dispute with auction house, interrupt planning meeting attended by Diana L Taylor, Sotheby's board member and girlfriend of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg; demand that Taylor help end lockout, but Taylor refuses. Photo (M)
docs.snippet: Art handlers for Sotheby's, locked out of their jobs since August in an increasingly bitter union contract dispute with the auction house, have been both inventive and voluble in their protest tactics, traveling to London to picket auctions and even...

headline.main: Sotheby's Workers in Labor Dispute Confront Mayor's Girlfriend

docs.abstract: Diana L. Taylor, a Sotheby’s board member, made clear her lack of sympathy with the workers’ demands.
docs.snippet: Diana L. Taylor, a Sotheby’s board member, made clear her lack of sympathy with the workers’ demands.

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman was charged with self-abortion in the first degree, the police said Thursday, becoming only the fifth woman charged with self-abortion since 1980.

headline.seo: Self-Abortion Charge After Fetus Found in Trash in Washington Heights
headline.main: After Fetus Is Found in Trash, a Rare Charge of Self-Abortion
headline.print_headline: After Fetus Is Found in Trash, A Rare Charge of Self-Abortion

docs.abstract: Yaribely Almonte becomes the fifth woman in New York State since 1980 to be charged with self-abortion in the first degree, a misdemeanor; Almonte left her aborted fetus in household garbage at her apartment building in the Washington Heights section of Manhattan.
docs.snippet: A woman was charged with self-abortion in the first degree, the police said Thursday, becoming only the fifth woman charged with self-abortion since 1980.

byline.contributor: Al Baker and Daniel Krieger contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new airport might ease the pinch in a city where overall passenger numbers could reach 400 million by 2050.

headline.seo: As a Financial Center, London Needs an Air Hub
headline.main: As a Financial Center, London Needs an Air Hub
headline.print_headline: A Finance Center Needs an Air Hub

docs.abstract: Reuters BreakingViews column; construction of a new London airport would have considerable advantages for the city, but private investors will require state assistance for project to become financially viable; shares of pharmaceutical companies, once a safe haven during troubled market periods, are trading at historic lows as governments cut back on health spending.
docs.snippet: A new airport might ease the pinch in a city where overall passenger numbers could reach 400 million by 2050.

byline.original: By ROBERT COLE and ROBERT CYRAN

docs.lead_paragraph: Michael C. Woodford said Wednesday that he would resign from Olympus’s board and work with supportive shareholders to plan an eventual return to his former job.

headline.print_headline: Former Olympus C.E.O. Resigns as Company Director
